message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.NE 

This paper is likely to belong to the Natural Language Processing (NLP) subfield of Computer Science, as it deals with rare word representation and word embeddings. Specifically, it focuses on evaluating and comparing techniques for handling infrequent words, which is a common problem in NLP. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which is dedicated to NLP research. 

The paper also involves machine learning techniques for word representation, which suggests that it could belong to the sub-category cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the use of expert annotations and evaluation metrics indicates that it could be relevant to the sub-categories cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.IR (Information Retrieval). Finally, the focus on achieving high performance on a challenging benchmark suggests that it could be relevant to the sub-category cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing).
